intro: Browallia tingo-mariae, commonly known as the Tingo-Mariae browallia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of Peru. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions with cool, moist conditions, and it thrives in well-drained soil. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, with five petals and a distinctive yellow center, making it a striking ornamental plant. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
